document.masterDocTitle: Six new species, complementary descriptions and new records from the Neotropical Region of the spider genus Dipoena (Araneae: Theridiidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Six new species, complementary descriptions and new records from the Neotropical Region of the spider genus Dipoena (Araneae: Theridiidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Dipoena niteroi Levi, 1963 : 166
, figs. 181–182 (Male holotype from Niteroi , Rio de Janeiro, Brazil , deposited in the Muséum National d’Histoire Naturelle, Paris, not examined); Platnick, 2013 .

Diagnosis. The female of
Dipoena niteroi
resembles that of
Dipoena obscura Keyserling, 1891
(see Levi, 1963 : 164 , figs. 169–170 ) in the presence of two pairs of rounded spermathecae with the first pair more developed, median copulatory opening and ducts are sclerotized ( Figs. 42, 43 ), differs from it in the first pair of spermathecae more separated from each other (
Figs. 43
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 41–43.
Dipoena niteroi
Levi
, 1963
: (41–43) Female: (41) body, dorsal. (42–43) Epigynum: (42) ventral, (43) dorsal, cleared (FS: first spermathecae; SS, second spermathecae). Scale bars: 0.25 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation. Females (n= 5 ). Total length 1.32–1.80 ; carapace length 0.48–0.63 ; femur I 0.48–0.52 . Carapace colour pattern from pale yellow to yellow; amount of white pigment on the abdomen varies.
Remarks. Males and females were collected together in various localities in Brazil .
Distribution. Brazil (Bahia, Minas Gerais, Espírito Santo, Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo, Santa Catarina e Rio Grande do Sul).
